description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ca8fh","text":"For metabarcoding purpose, the first step involves the amplification by PCR of a given gene region (for example V4 or V9 region of 18S rRNA gene) or gene itself if its size does not exceed 600bp (the longest fragment size that can be sequenced by Illumina technology). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vnmg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf6vr","text":"The defined forward and reverse primers that are complementary upstream and downstream of the region of interest, needs to be designed with overhang adapters which will be used in a subsequent limited‐cycle amplification step, in order to add the dual‐index barcodes and Illumina flow cell adapters. To design illumina primers, it will be necessary to know the sequencing method, and therefore the adapters sequence. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"crugg","text":"Send to the sequencing platform pictures of gel to check they are conform (purity, degradation, bands intensity, etc) and follow its protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l59d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qrjb","text":"Once PCR products are correct, they are organized in appropriated PCR plates to send (dryice) to the sequencing platform and generate libraries.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bin4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aev3t","text":"We use a high throughput sequencing using paired-end 2x250bp Illumina MiSeq.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bptp9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d08vl","text":"If the illumina sequencing is realized on the Genomer Platform in Roscoff (France), see the protocols.io \"Preparation of libraries (Metabarcoding) for Illumina sequencing - Genomer Platform\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":62},{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":128}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2850n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ser2","text":"Below is a suggestion of protocols for 18S amplification from total genomic DNA. This protocol has been tested and used with success.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3jkk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j79r","text":"However, before starting the library preparation, few samples from the batch (es) to be analyzed should be selected and the PCR conditions should be tested. The tests can be performed by using the primers without the illumina “tail” which are less expensive since it can be order by normal purification method, like Se-POP. By using also these primers, it avoids excessive manipulation of the primers with the illumina tail and therefore the chances of contamination. Low number of cycles, pool multiple (i.e., triplicate) PCRs for each sample, high initial time of denaturation are fundamental practices for the PCR when targeting diversity studies and should be considered for all reactions, including the tests in order to reduce or avoid PCR bias caused by PCR selection and PCR drift.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rpb9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sbvo","text":"• PCR  selection includes all mechanisms which inherently favor the amplification of certain templates due to properties of the genes and/or of their flanking sequences of the target region. Potentially important contributors to PCR selection are preferential denaturation due to overall low GC content, higher binding efficiency of GC-rich permutations of degenerate primers, differential accessibility of rRNA genes within genomes, and correlation between amplification probabilities and gene copy numbers within genomes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51kum","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am5vt","text":"• PCR drift is cause by stochastic variation in the early cycles of the reaction (when amplification still proceeds largely from the genomic templates), and its outcome should therefore not be reproducible in replicate PCR amplifications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jem8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lsa5","text":"More details about these biases can be found in the following references: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2p9se","text":"-Aird, D. et al. Analyzing and minimizing PCR amplification bias in Illumina sequencing libraries. Genome Biol. 12, R18 (2011).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmr4s","text":"-Wagner, A. et al. Surveys of Gene Families Using Polymerase Chain Reaction: PCR Selection and PCR Drift. Syst. Biol. 43, 250 (1994).-Polz, M. F. \u0026 Cavanaugh, C. M. Bias in template-to-product ratios in multitemplate PCR. Appl. Environ. Microbiol. 64, 3724–3730 (1998).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2op40","text":"Use the existing primers (Table 1 \u0026 Table 2) or design your own custom gene primers with the proper Illumina indices and Index adaptor orientations. These adapters will be different in function of the libraries preparation protocol, and therefore in function of sequencing platform (Table 2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qpof","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s8hb","text":"PCR amplification of the V4 region of the 18S rDNA (~380 bp) using primers TAReuk454FWD1 (V4F) and V4 18S Next.Rev (TAReukREV3_modified or V4R_Zig) allow to amplify most eukaryotic groups and to solve the problem of the under-representation of Haptophytes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1ulu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5v6a1","text":"Natural samples usually have more DNA than sorted cells samples, so the V4 region of the 18S rRNA gene can be amplified by a single PCR reaction (without the need of a nested protocol).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2b560","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c5iu","text":"It is recommended to order the illumina primers with a good synthesis and purity parameters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73ss7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1eqhc","text":"We have ordered at EUROGENTEC the Illumina primers with RP-HPLC purification method, 10 or 40nmol synthesis scale and at 100µM TE concentration. We could also ordered in dried and dissolve them with nuclease free water or TE 1x buffer to obtain 100µM stock solution (as described on the Eurogentec’s technical data sheet).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9i3c","text":"Then we dilute them to 10 μM working concentration (1/10th the typical 100 μM working stock concentration for primers). {"blocks":[{"key":"9jpdi","text":"Test a negative control for each series.
